content.raw: Also, do you mind answering all comments to make sure that all the feedback has been addressed? Ideally, with the commit that solves the suggestion. It's a little bit of extra work but much more convenient for the reviewers.

 std::cerr << "Service call failed" << std::endl;

update.description:
Not all the service requests require a response. We'd add some logic for removing the service request handler after sending the request, instead of waiting for the response. We could use the msgs::Empty for not having to modify the wire format when sending a service request. We'd create a new Request function in the Node class with only one parameter (the input parameter).

Two examples are included SrvProviderOneway and RequesterOneway.

Integration tests are also added.
update.title: Service requests without response

content.raw: We're missing the integration test files, you probably forgot to add them to the repository.
content.html: We're missing the integration test files, you probably forgot to add them to the repository.

content.raw: You should also create some integration tests to make sure that everything works as expected when the nodes are running on different processes. Take a look at pull request #151.
content.html: You should also create some integration tests to make sure that everything works as expected when the nodes are running on different processes. Take a look at pull request #151.

content.raw: Add `req.set_data(data);` to fill the input message. This is important because the callback that receives the message checks that the content is `data`.
content.html: Add req.set_data(data); to fill the input message. This is important because the callback that receives the message checks that the content is data.

content.raw: You need to add the `++counter;` line inside your callback
content.html: You need to add the ++counter; line inside your callback

content.raw: I don't think this should return `false`. When you request a service you don't know if the types are bad when you do the request. You may be interested in requesting these particular types for some reason. What we know is that the request should return true but none of our callbacks should be executed (there are no service providers with these specific types).
content.html: I don't think this should return false. When you request a service you don't know if the types are bad when you do the request. You may be interested in requesting these particular types for some reason. What we know is that the request should return true but none of our callbacks should be executed (there are no service providers with these specific types).

content.raw: Is this test testing something new that we didn't test in previous tests?
content.html: Is this test testing something new that we didn't test in previous tests?

content.raw: I don't think we're supporting synchronous service calls in oneway requests (probably doesn't make sense).
content.html: I don't think we're supporting synchronous service calls in oneway requests (probably doesn't make sense).

content.raw:
* Use `\brief` only in header files. The comment is not 100% clear. How about something like this:

Remove the handler associated to this service request. We won't receive a response because this is a oneway request.

* How about moving this block outside of the `try-catch` block?
content.html:
• Use \brief only in header files. The comment is not 100% clear. How about something like this:

Remove the handler associated to this service request. We won't receive a response because this is a oneway request.

  • How about moving this block outside of the try-catch block?

content.raw: Could you indent this \param line to make it clear that we're describing the parameter of the callback?
content.html: Could you indent this \param line to make it clear that we're describing the parameter of the callback?

content.html: Could you indent this \param line to make it clear that we're describing the parameter of the callback?

content.html: Can we move this block right after the call to RunCallback() a few lines above?

content.html: Could you indent this \param line to make it clear that we're describing the parameter of the callback?

content.raw: Could you print the request received? Otherwise there's no way to check if the request has been received.
content.html: Could you print the request received? Otherwise there's no way to check if the request has been received.

content.html: Use #include <ignition/msgs.hh> instead

The style checker shows two warnings:


```
#!c++

caguero@bb9:~/workspace/ign-transport_amtj$ sh tools/code_check.sh 
[src/Node_TEST.cc:800]: (style) Variable 'advCb' is assigned a value that is never used.
[src/Node_TEST.cc:810]: (style) Variable 'reqCb' is assigned a value that is never used.
```
